articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China on Monday announced export controls on some drone-related equipment, saying it wanted to safeguard "national security and interests" amid escalating tension with the United States over access to technology.
articles.title: China curbs exports of drone-related equipment amid U.S. tech tension

articles.author: Summer Zhen, Carolina Mandl
articles.description: For all the excitement whipped up in China's markets by the Politburo last week, foreign investors say policymakers' words will have to be matched by substantive action to clean up an ailing property sector before confidence recovers.
articles.title: Analysis: Words only go so far: Investors want property fixed before buying China

articles.author: Giulio Piovaccari
articles.description: Lamborghini could sell 10,000 cars this year for the first time, its CEO said, as the luxury sports carmaker reported a rise in profit and revenues for the first half.
articles.title: Lamborghini could hit 10,000 sales this year, CEO says

articles.author: Noel Randewich
articles.description: It's a high bar, but companies reporting second-quarter earnings in recent weeks have talked up artificial intelligence even more than in the previous quarter.
articles.title: Companies double down on AI in June-quarter analyst calls

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The chairman of NatWest (NWG.L) Howard Davies should remain in office to ensure stability for the bank, a senior official at Britain's Financial Conduct Authority said on Monday.
articles.title: UK financial watchdog urges NatWest chair to stay put

articles.author: Yousef Saba
articles.description: Abu Dhabi National Oil Company brought forward its net zero carbon emissions target by five years to 2045 on Monday as OPEC member the United Arab Emirates prepares to host a major U.N. climate conference in December.
articles.title: UAE oil giant raises climate goal ahead of key UN summit

articles.author: Sachin Ravikumar
articles.description: Britain will grant more than 100 new oil and gas licences in the North Sea as part of efforts to tap domestic supplies and become more energy independent, the government said on Monday.
articles.title: Britain to grant over 100 new North Sea oil and gas licences

articles.author: Julie Steenhuysen
articles.description: Groundbreaking treatments for Alzheimer's disease that work by removing a toxic protein called beta amyloid from the brain may benefit whites more than Black Americans, whose disease may be driven by other factors, leading Alzheimer's experts told Reuters.
articles.title: Insight: Promising new Alzheimer's drugs may benefit whites more than Blacks

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.description: Throughout the Federal Reserve's drive to kill inflation, policymakers have focused on raising the benchmark overnight interest rate high enough to do the job and getting it there fast enough to keep the public from losing faith.
articles.title: Clock on the Fed's 'soft landing' may already be ticking

articles.author: Nicholas Brown
articles.description: A giant, glowing X marks the San Francisco spot where Elon Musk says he plans to keep his company, the messaging platform X, formerly known as Twitter. But city officials and some residents are unhappy with the display.
articles.title: Musk draws heat from San Francisco over giant X logo
